recall.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past
recall.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
I seem to recall I’ve met him before somewhere.
I don’t recall seeing any cars parked outside.
I can’t recall who gave me the information.
recall.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to officially tell someone to come back to a place or group
recall.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
The Ambassador was recalled from Washington.
recall.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if a company recalls one of its products, it asks people who have bought it to return it because there may be something wrong with it
recall.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
recall.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to bring information back onto the screen of a computer
recall.translation[0].definitions[4].def: if something recalls something else, it makes you think of it because it is very similar
recall.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to vote to remove someone from their political position
recall.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the ability to remember something that you have learned or experienced
recall.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: A child’s recall is usually accurate.
He had total recall  (=remembered everything) of every play in the game.
recall.translation[1].definitions[1].def: an official order telling someone to return to a place, especially before they expected to
recall.translation[1].definitions[2].def: when a company asks people to return a product they have bought because there may be something wrong with it
recall.translation[1].definitions[3].def: a vote to remove someone from their political position, or the act of being removed by a vote
recall.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: the recall of four city council members
recall.translation[2].definitions[0].def: if a company recalls one of its products, it asks customers to return it because there may be something wrong with it
recall.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The company was forced to recall one range of cereals after several packets were found to be contaminated.
recall.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to officially tell someone to come back
recall.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The U.S. recalled its ambassador in protest.
Some 30,000 auto workers were recalled from layoffs.
recall.translation[2].definitions[2].def: to remember something that you have seen or heard, such as an advertisement
recall.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: Consumers’ ability to recall TV commercials has dropped steadily.
